SPI Parameters. More...

Detailed Description

SPI Parameters.

SPI Parameters are used to with the SPI_open() call. Default values for these parameters are set using SPI_Params_init().

See also
SPI_Params_init()

Field Documentation

uint8_t SPI_Params_t::csHold

CS Hold enable

uintptr_t SPI_Params_t::custom

Custom argument used by driver implementation

uint32_t SPI_Params_t::dataSize

SPI data frame size in bits, only 8 and 16 are supported

uint8_t SPI_Params_t::dmaEnable

DMA mode enable. When Dma mode is disable, SPI driver is operated in polling mode, there is while(1) loop waiting for hardware to finish

DMA_Handle SPI_Params_t::dmaHandle

System DMA Handle

uint8_t SPI_Params_t::eccEnable

ECC mode enable

SPI_FrameFormat SPI_Params_t::frameFormat

SPI frame format, refer to SPI_FrameFormat_e

SPI_MasterModeParams SPI_Params_t::masterParams

Configuration dedicated to master mode, refer to SPI_MasterModeParams_t

SPI_Mode SPI_Params_t::mode

Master or Slave mode, refer to SPI_Mode_e

SPI_PinMode SPI_Params_t::pinMode

Pin operation Mode, refer to SPI_PinMode_e

SPI_DataShiftFmt SPI_Params_t::shiftFormat

SPI Data shift format, refer to SPI_DataShiftFmt_e

SPI_SlaveModeParams SPI_Params_t::slaveParams

Configuration dedicated to slave mode, refer to SPI_SlaveModeParams_t

SPI_CallbackFxn SPI_Params_t::transferCallbackFxn

Callback function pointer, refer to SPI_CallbackFxn

SPI_TransferMode SPI_Params_t::transferMode

Blocking or Callback mode

uint32_t SPI_Params_t::transferTimeout

Transfer timeout in system ticks (Not supported with all implementations

uint16_t SPI_Params_t::txDummyValue

16 bit value transmitted when no TX data is provided for SPI_tranfer()
